description: If you created a Shield Advanced policy, returns policy-level attack summary information in the event of a potential DDoS attack. Other policy types are currently unsupported.

parameters.name: PolicyId
parameters.description: The ID of the policy for which you want to get the attack information.

nested_items.name: AdminAccountId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Firewall Manager administrator account for this policy.

nested_items.name: ServiceType
nested_items.description: The service type that is protected by the policy. Currently, this is always SHIELD_ADVANCED.

nested_items.name: Data
nested_items.description: Details about the attack, including the following:

nested_items.type: ongoing attacks will not have an end time
nested_items.description: End time of the attack (ongoing attacks will not have an end time)

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If you have more objects than the number that you specified for MaxResults in the request, the response includes a NextToken value. To list more objects, submit another GetProtectionStatus request, and specify the NextToken value from the response in the NextToken value in the next request.
